dt: {bc}a specific and usually public mention or acknowledgment of someone or something by name

dt.t: It's not surprising that Chekhov gets a {wi}namecheck{/wi} in {it}Marion Bridge{/it}, which is playing in a superbly performed production through Aug. 25 at Hudson Village Theatre … . That Chekhov nod comes from boozy, disillusioned actress Agnes (Leni Parker), whose unsuccessful career has included appearing in plays by the Russian master …

[Marianne] Williamson began giving her talks in 1983 at the Philosophical Research Society on Los Feliz Boulevard (the nonprofit, which gets a {wi}name-check{/wi} in McWilliam's chapter on the abundant flowering of Southern California occultism, is still in operation).

shortdef: a specific and usually public mention or acknowledgment of someone or something by name

dt: {bc}to mention or acknowledge (someone or something) specifically and publicly by name

dt.t: … he is an avid collector of contemporary art, although he alone turns the pursuit to his singular ends in lyrics that knowingly {wi}name-check{/wi} everyone from Jeff Koons to Jean-Michel Basquiat.
{ldquo}… I couldn't wait that long for another box of Shipley's,{rdquo} he said, {wi}name-checking{/wi} the local doughnut shop that catered the event.
Last year, the show's fans successfully petitioned for McDonald's to bring back its limited-edition Szechuan sauce from 1998 after it was {wi}namechecked{/wi} in an episode.
